Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class InlineBitSet

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.BitSet
com.shouldis.bitset.InlineBitSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class InlineBitSet
extends BitSet
Implementation of BitSet in which most methods are manually inlined to increase performance by reducing the overhead from the call-stack at the cost of readability. However, methods still have the exact behavior as their BitSet counterpart they override. Long.bitCount(long) intentionally isn't inlined to retain existing VM optimizations.
Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
BitSet, Serialized Form

    Changes the state of a bit at the specified index to the dead state.
    void clear​(int from, int to)
    Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) to the dead state.
    void emptyWord​(int wordIndex)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to 0, removing all bits in the live state.
    void fillWord​(int wordIndex)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to BitSet.LIVE, setting all bits to the live state.

    Changes the state of the bit at the specified index to its opposite through an XOR operation.
    void flip​(int from, int to)
    Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) to their opposites through an XOR operation.
    void flipWord​(int wordIndex)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the complement of its current state.

    Checks the current state of the bit at the specified index.

      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be checked.

    • set

      public void set​(int from, int to)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) to the live state. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to. ConcurrentBitSet will only perform this atomically on each word within the range individually.
      Overrides:
      set in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be changed to the live state.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be changed to the live state.

    • notAndWord

      public void notAndWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of a NOT AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] & mask);
      Overrides:
      notAndWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the NOT AND operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the NOT AND operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.

    • notOrWord

      public void notOrWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of a NOT OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      Performs words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] | mask);
      Overrides:
      notOrWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the NOT OR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the NOT OR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.

      Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of a NOT XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.

      Overrides:
      notXOrWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:

    • setWordSegment

      public void setWordSegment​(int wordIndex, long word, long mask)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words such that it retains the previous state of bits where the bits of mask are in the dead state, and takes on the value of bits in word where mask has bits in the live state.
      Overrides:
      setWordSegment in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to change.
      word - the new long value to be set to BitSet.words.
      mask - the mask used to determine which bits from word will be applied.
